attributes.action: respond to petitions in a clear and concise manner, in plain English and without the use of jargon.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I believe that the Prime Minister does not address concerns raised in petitions in an appropriate manner. Too many times responses have not been clear, concise and in plain English.  They are often full of legal terminology and are too long winded. 

The recent petition about AM-FM-Radio is an excellent example.  The response could have been summed up like this:

“We will only switch off AM-FM Radio when over 50% of the people listening are doing so on digital. Currently it’s 20%.”

However, there is no clear response to the main points of the petition.

Another point is that a petition has to be kept to 1000 characters, the government’s response is unlimited. E.g. The response to the AM-FM Radio petition is 1722 characters long.

In a nutshell my petition is that the government’s responses to petitions should be limited to 1000 characters as well in plain English and concise. However if the response is in plain English and concise there should be no need for the limit of 1000 characters.

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
